page.title: 17CHANGES IN FECKENHAM
page.content: A lady came to visit us who had lived in the village for over 70 years. She said that she went to school at our school. There were four classes in the school then and children stayed until they were 14 years old. The school was heated with a big black stove in the classrooms. We can still see the chimney and the place where the fire was in our classroom. They used to sit on a long form and the blackboard was moveable. There were no school dinners, you had to go home or take sandwiches. She said the girls had knitting, sewing, darning, and laundry lessons.They went to Astwood Bank school for cooking lessons. They had assemblies in the morning. If they were naughty or late they had a smack across the head or they had the cane. There were no pictures on the classroom walls. cont.
